P.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100. For these purposes we'll define humans as biological creatures who have as their ancestors – via a chain of live births from mothers – circa 2000 humans OR who could mate with circa 2000 humans to produce viable offspring. (So AIs, ems, genetically engineered beings of a different species brought up in artificial wombs, etc. would not count). Any living humans living anywhere in the observable universe (or multiverse) (who are known to the entities operating Metaculus) on that date will be sufficient to resolve the question negatively.
N.B. Even though it is obviously the case that if human extinction occurs Metaculus points won't be very valuable anymore and that it will be practically impossible to check for true human extinction (zero humans left), I would like to ask people not to let this fact influence their prediction and to predict in good faith

Q_given_P.title: Given that humans go extinct before 2100, will a sample of negative energy be produced by the year 2100?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if humans do not go extinct before 2100. If the condition is met (if humans go extinct before 2100), then resolves YES if a sample of negative energy material (> 10 proton masses worth) is created and confined to a volume of less than 1 cubic centimeter for longer than 1 microsecond by the year 2100, and NO if it's not achieved by that time.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that humans go extinct before 2100 AND a sample of negative energy is produced by 2100, will Metaculus exist in 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either condition of the forecast P is not met. If both conditions are met (humans go extinct before 2100 AND a sample of negative energy is produced by 2100), then resolves YES if Metaculus exists in 2030 according to the resolution criteria provided for the forecast Q, and NO if it does not.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will humans go extinct before 2100 AND will Metaculus exist in 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if there are no known humans alive on January 1, 2100 AND Metaculus exists in 2030 according to the specified criteria. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030. The landing itself of the human crew on Mars must occur before January 1, 2030, 00:00 UTC.
At least one person aboard the lander must survive the landing, however it is not necessary for the person to survive long-term or make a return trip to Earth, nor is it necessary for the mission to intend a return or long-term survival.
A "SpaceX-branded" mission is defined to mean that the SpaceX-associated logos on the spacecraft involved (both the boosters and the Mars-bound craft) have a larger surface area than the logos of any other entity

Q_given_P.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if SpaceX does not land people on Mars before 2030. If the condition is met (if SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030), then resolves YES if a message originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045, and NO if it's not detected by that time.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030 and a message from Luyten's Star is detected before 2046, will there be a complete 4-year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1-year interval in which world output doubles?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either condition is not met. If both conditions are met, resolves based on the credible assessment of world GDP in constant US dollars to determine if there will be a complete 4-year interval in which world output doubles before the first 1-year interval in which world output doubles.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030 AND will we detect a message from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030 AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030. The landing itself of the human crew on Mars must occur before January 1, 2030, 00:00 UTC.
At least one person aboard the lander must survive the landing, however it is not necessary for the person to survive long-term or make a return trip to Earth, nor is it necessary for the mission to intend a return or long-term survival.
A "SpaceX-branded" mission is defined to mean that the SpaceX-associated logos on the spacecraft involved (both the boosters and the Mars-bound craft) have a larger surface area than the logos of any other entity

Q_given_P.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if SpaceX does not land people on Mars before 2030. If the condition is met (if SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030), then resolves YES if a practical nuclear fusion reactor is first developed in China and NO if it is developed elsewhere. If no such reactor is built before January 1, 2050, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030 and a practical nuclear fusion reactor is developed in China, will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either SpaceX does not land people on Mars before 2030 or a practical nuclear fusion reactor is not developed in China. If both conditions are met (SpaceX lands people on Mars before 2030 and a practical nuclear fusion reactor is developed in China), then resolves YES if the richest person in the world in 2033 has a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will SpaceX land people on Mars before 2030 AND will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China AND will the richest person in the world in 2033 have a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if a SpaceX-branded mission successfully lands one or more living human beings on the surface of Mars before 2030 AND the first practical nuclear fusion reactor is developed in China AND the richest person in the world in 2033 has a net worth equivalent to or greater than 2% of the United States' GDP at the time. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

Q_given_P.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if there is not at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100. If the condition is met (if there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100), then resolves YES if Puerto Rico becomes a US state before 2035 and NO if it does not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 AND Puerto Rico will become a US state prior to 2035, will Metaculus exist in 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions are not met. If the conditions are met (if there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 and Puerto Rico becomes a US state before 2035), then resolves YES if Metaculus exists in 2030 according to the resolution criteria provided and NO if it does not.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 AND will Puerto Rico become a US state prior to 2035 AND will Metaculus exist in 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years with the average global temperature at least 2.0 ˚C greater than in 1880 AND Puerto Rico becomes a US state before January 1, 2035 AND Metaculus exists in 2030 according to the specified criteria. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be more VR headset sales than AR headsets sales in 2025?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as "Yes" if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year. Credible industry reports will be required for resolution.
For the purposes of this question, an "augmented reality headset" is defined as a device which is portable and worn over the user's head, and whose primary use is in augmented reality functions. "Augmented reality functions" are defined as recognizing and interpreting objects in the user's real environment, and producing digital information and images overlaid over the user's view of their real environment, which update in real time as the user moves and interacts with the digital and physical environment.
For the purposes of this question, a "virtual reality headset" is defined as a device which is portable and worn over the user's head, and whose primary use is in virtual reality functions. "virtual reality functions" are defined as mostly or entirely covering the user's field of view, and tracking the user's viewpoint in 6 degrees of freedom, which the user can interact with through movement, voice, or other controls.
In the case that a device is capable of both AR and VR functionality, it will be considered an AR device only in the calculation of resolution. Devices such as smartphones in 2021, whose primary functions are not intended as AR or VR, do not qualify for the purposes of this question

Q_given_P.title: Given that in 2025, there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales, will we reach the island of stability by 2050?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the condition about VR and AR headset sales is not met in 2025. If the condition is met (if there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025), then resolves YES if we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons that has a half-life of at least one day prior to 2050, and the half-life is verified by an independent scientific team. Resolves NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that in 2025 there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales AND we reach the island of stability by 2050, will a human-made spaceship enter the Venusian atmosphere before 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for VR and AR headset sales or reaching the island of stability are not met. If both conditions are met (more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025 and reaching the island of stability by 2050), then resolves YES if a human-made spaceship enters the Venusian atmosphere before 2030, NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will there be more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025 AND will we reach the island of stability by 2050?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year AND we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons, having a half-life of at least one day (86,400 seconds) prior to 2050. Both criteria must be met for a YES resolution. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government

Q_given_P.title: Given that China reduces their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030, will there be more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if China does not reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030. If the condition is met (if China reduces emissions as specified by 2030), then resolves YES if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year, and NO if it's not the case in 2025.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that China reduces their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030 AND there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025, will a human-made spaceship enter the Venusian atmosphere before 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if China does not reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030 or if there are not more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025. If both conditions are met (China reduces emissions and VR sales exceed AR sales), then resolves positively if a human-made spaceship enters Venus's atmosphere before 2030 based on credible reports by space agencies such as NASA or ESA.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will China meet their carbon emissions reduction target AND will a human-made spaceship enter the Venusian atmosphere before 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if China achieves a 60% reduction in carbon emissions per GDP by 2030 AND a human-made spaceship enters the Venusian atmosphere before 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Zermelo's theorem says that only one of three possibilities is possible in a 2-player solved game; First player (white) wins, second player (black) wins, or there is a forced draw.
In the game of chess, these outcomes correspond to:
White wins
Black wins
Forced draw
If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
For the purpose of this question, chess is considered to be solved if
it is proved that white will win, lose or draw from the initial position, given perfect play on both sides
it is shown that there exists a unique result of perfect play from the initial position, which is either: white wins, black wins, or forced draw
Resolution is by publication of peer-reviewed article that is not shown to be mistaken for at least 3 years post-publication.
For the purpose of this question, the 50-move rule does not force a draw. Games that don't end, are considered drawn, for the purpose of this question
This question resolves ambiguously if the question does not resolve before Jan 1st, 2080.

Q_given_P.title: If chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning, will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 or if perfect play does not result in white winning. If chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning, then resolves YES if the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty and NO if it does not meet the targets by January 1, 2030.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play must result in white winning AND the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty, will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 or if the European Union does not meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty. If both conditions are met (chess is solved before 2080 with perfect play resulting in white winning and the EU meets its 2030 targets), then resolves YES if any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up before 2035 according to the specified criteria, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning AND will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play must result in white winning AND one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up before 2035. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 (U.S., China, Russia, U.K., France, Israel, India, Pakistan, or North Korea) is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035.
Fine Print
For the purposes of this question, in the case of territorial disputes or challenges to a government's legitimacy, successor governments will be recognized as those which hold over 50% of the nation's de facto controlled territory on July 1, 2017. The successor government must also hold a political capital city within that same territory. If any of the 9 countries no longer exist or have no succesor as defined by January 1, 2035, they will be ignored for the resolution of the question.

Q_given_P.title: Given that by January 1, 2035, no country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up, will there be more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if by January 1, 2035, any of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives up their nuclear weapons. If the condition is met (if none of the countries give up their nuclear weapons), then resolves YES if the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year, and NO if it does not.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that by January 1, 2035, a country known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up and there are more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if by January 1, 2035, no country known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 gives them up or if the number of VR headset sales does not exceed AR headset sales in 2025. If both conditions are met, resolves as per the criteria for the development of a practical nuclear fusion reactor in China.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035 AND will there be more VR headset sales than AR headset sales in 2025?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035 AND the number of virtual reality headsets sold globally in 2025 exceeds the number of augmented reality headsets sold in the same year. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

Q_given_P.title: Given that there will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if there is not at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100. If the condition is met (if there is at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100), then resolves YES if a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin originating from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045, and NO if it's not detected before that date.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that by January 1, 2100, there has been at least 2˚C of global warming and a message originating from Luyten's Star has been detected before 2046, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either of the conditions (global warming or message from Luyten's Star) is not met. If both conditions are met, resolves YES if the first practical nuclear fusion reactor is developed in China, and NO if it is developed elsewhere. If no reactor is built before January 1, 2050, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100 AND will we detect a message originating from Luyten's Star before 2046?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years with the average global temperature at least 2.0 ˚C greater than in 1880 AND a signal of unambiguously intelligent and extraterrestrial origin from Luyten's Star is detected on or near Earth on or before December 31, 2045. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Zermelo's theorem says that only one of three possibilities is possible in a 2-player solved game; First player (white) wins, second player (black) wins, or there is a forced draw.
In the game of chess, these outcomes correspond to:
White wins
Black wins
Forced draw
If chess is solved before 2080, must perfect play result in white winning?
For the purpose of this question, chess is considered to be solved if
it is proved that white will win, lose or draw from the initial position, given perfect play on both sides
it is shown that there exists a unique result of perfect play from the initial position, which is either: white wins, black wins, or forced draw
Resolution is by publication of peer-reviewed article that is not shown to be mistaken for at least 3 years post-publication.
For the purpose of this question, the 50-move rule does not force a draw. Games that don't end, are considered drawn, for the purpose of this question
This question resolves ambiguously if the question does not resolve before Jan 1st, 2080.

Q_given_P.title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning, will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if chess is not solved before 2080 or if perfect play does not result in white winning. If the condition is met (chess is solved before 2080 and perfect play results in white winning), then resolves YES if the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty and NO if it does not meet the targets by January 1, 2030.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that chess is solved before 2080 and the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty, will we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons, that has a half-life of at least one day prior to 2050?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if either chess is not solved before 2080 or the European Union does not meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty. If both conditions are met (chess is solved before 2080 and the EU meets its 2030 targets), then resolves YES if we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons, that has a half-life of at least one day prior to 2050, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: If chess is solved before 2080, the European Union meets its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty, and we reach the island of stability by 2050, will perfect play result in white winning?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if chess is solved before 2080, a credible news report confirms that the European Union has met all three 2030 climate action goals under the Paris Climate Treaty on or before January 1, 2030, AND we create an isotope of an element with more than 110 protons that has a half-life of at least one day prior to 2050. Resolves NO otherwise.
